ratings.comment: I've taken two mathematics courses with Professor Mingzhong Cai. I'd just like to mention that his teaching ability is phenomenal. Besides offering a very organized presentation of the material, he writes very clearly on the board, and draws nice diagrams. To top it all off, he also gives nice intuition for the objects being discussed.

Cai was horrendously difficult to understand, if I hadn't taken this class in high school I would have received a very low grade. He goes off on random tangents constantly and can't understand a medium difficulty question, much less answer it. HW/Quiz-20%, Tests-20,20,40. Tests weren't too difficult, but I studied a ton.
Literally the worst professor I have had thus far in any given subject.  Math typically came naturally to me, but his class as well as exams made that statement false.  His class will defeat you.

He had hard exams, but the curve helped a lot. Do your homework because it's 20% of your grade. Put things on exams that he didn't teach and that were't in the book. You have to make sure you understand the topic fully or else you won't do well. The final was the hardest math test I have ever seen. Exams get harder each time.

The worst professor I've had by far.  Took this same class at another university last year and after putting in twice the amount of work this year I received 2 grades lower. His class material is easy but the tests are somehow impossible. Don't listen to what he tells you won't be on the test, because I guarantee it will be. Avoid him at all costs.

Worst professor I've ever had, and hardest class I've ever taken. The exams are extremely difficult and he is not clear about what and what isn't being tested. He should not be teaching a mandatory class for a some students. He may be smart, but he is not a good teacher. Seems like he WANTS you to fail.

Worst professor I've ever had.  All of the below comments are spot on, he was pretentious and confusing.  Tests were far beyond what he introduced in what was supposed to be a fundamentals of calculus class.  Maybe instead of trying to "defeat those who do not understand calculus," he should try to teach it.  Do not take a class with him.

Hardest class I've ever taken. He made no sense most of the time and was not a great public speaker. Tests were far beyond what we learned but there was a nice curve (155/200 was an A for one midterm). Absolutely horrible though, take a different class/teacher.
Try to avoid him, he tries to "defeat" you with his insanely hard tests.

I had to take this course again because it didn't transfer over to UW as equivalent. I learned a lot about calculus last year and did well in that class, and this time I got the exact same material presented in a really confusing way that was not productive at all. Cai is a genius but he should not be teaching entry-level calculus. Not recommended.

He doesn't teach you anything that will be expected on the exam, he's pretentious about his level of ability.  In a class that is suppose to be just about teaching fundamentals for students looking to fulfill a requirement this guy makes it his mission to quote "defeat those who do not understand calculus."  Easily the worst professor I've had.

Professor Cai was the worst professor I have ever had at UW Madison. Very hard to understand and makes his exams unreasonably difficult. He once put a question on an exam that he said we would never have to know and it was worth 40/200 points. Stay away from him if you can.

I had a terrible time in his class.  Although he is a funny and nice guy, the tests never use status quo problems for the concepts you are learning.  Instead, he throws out the oddities that are much more difficult.  Sometimes he is difficult to understand.

Professor Mingzhong is a great professor! He is very quirky but an entertaining lecturer. He uses plenty of examples to help you learn, and only gives homework once per week. Do the homework and go to lecture and discussion and you will be fine. His midterms are somewhat difficult but as long as you put down work you will probably get credit.

Professor Cai does a great job of explaining concepts and is very clear when he speaks.  If you attend lecture and do the homework you will do fine on the exam.  His exams are difficult, but manageable. Make sure you attend lecture and don't be afraid to ask him questions!

I don't agree that he gives "super hard exams". He gave great lectures and actually everything in the midterm were in his lecture. He also drew great picture which helped a lot. Just attend the lectures and do your homework.

Professor Cai is awesome. I really enjoyed taking his class, largely because of his unique style. Exams are take-home but difficult--he told me I was the best student in the class, but I still needed 10+ hours to do each midterm. He gives proofs that differ from (and improve on) the book's, which is excellent. Overall, you can't do much better.

A good instructor for topology. His proofs are slick and intuitive, plus he is great at drawing pictures, which is pretty important if you want to understand what's going on, especially in algebraic topology. Exams were take home and difficult, homeworks were graded very tough. Overall a good teacher, but the grading was a little rough.
His tests are very difficult and go above and beyond what you may see in homework or quiz work.  Be prepared to study a lot!

Homework and quizzes are very straight forward and based on the textbook. First exam was a breeze, but then he seemed to overcompensate for that by making the second midterm and final nearly impossible. I studied like crazy and didn't even recognize the material on the final exam. Lecture is useless. Know your proofs!

this class is difficult. homework and quizzes aren't that bad but they do not prepare you for tests. he tested more on abstract concepts, not so much numerical examples like the homework was. i don't even know how i would have prepared for the tests. wouldn't recommend.
though helpful, he gives the hardest exams.
gives super hard exams.think ahead before you choose to take his class
Overall a decent professor, perfectly understandable. Lectures are sometimes useful, other times not. Rely on the book and do the HW's to learn. Exams are moderately difficult, but do-able.
